section.name: Installing JSpider
section.p: There are 2 ways to install JSpider on your system: downloading a binary (which is the most preferrable way, as it is the easiest), and building directly from our CVS repositories (which gives you access to the very latest additions, not yet included in any release).

subsection.name: IMPORTANT NOTE for Java 1.3 - XML Parser
subsection.p: JSpider needs an XML parser in order to read some of it's configuration files.
Starting from Java 1.4 (J2SE 1.4), the needed XML API's and an implementation of these are part of the platform.
For Java 1.3, however, you'll have to add these yourself. The best thing you can do is to download the open source XML parser Xerces from Apache.
You can find this XML parser for download here. You'll have to put the "xml-apis.jar" and "xercesImpl.jar" on your classpath before starting JSpider.
